net.objectzoo.delegates.adapters

Class ActionToAsyncAction<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.objectzoo.delegates.adapters.ActionToAsyncAction<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the Action's parameter
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.function.Consumer<T>, Action<T>

    public class ActionToAsyncAction<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Action<T>
    An adapter that converts an Action or Consumer to a new Action, that makes an asynchronous calls to the original Action0 upon invocation. This adapter provides no possibility to check for the completion of the original action nor to retrieve thrown exceptions. Thus it is recommended to use ActionToActionAsync adapter instead to achieve a similar result.

    All asynchronous calls are executed in another thread and forwarded to the Action.accept(Object) method.

    The Executor to use for the asynchronous invocations can be chosen during creation of this adapter. If no explicit executor is given the a default executor is used. The default executor can be set using the AsyncExecutor.setDefaultExecutor(Executor) property or is created automatically by the AsyncExecutor.

    Author:
    tilmann
